第２週
After eliminating that girl, I thought that my Senpai would be safe...=Depois de eliminar aquela garota, pensei que meu Senpai estaria seguro...
After eliminating that girl, I thought my Senpai would be safe...=Depois de eliminar aquela garota, pensei que meu Senpai estaria seguro...
...but now, I have a new problem to deal with.=...mas agora, eu tenho um novo problema para resolver.
Another girl is showing interest in him.=Outra garota está demonstrando interesse nele.
A cute tomboy with a gung-ho attitude.=Uma garota bonitinha e destemida.
Boys like that sort of girl, don't they?=Os meninos gostam desse tipo de garota, não gostam?
If he keeps spending time around her...=Se ele continuar passando tempo com ela...
...she might steal his heart.=...ela pode roubar o coração dele.
I can't let that happen.=Eu não posso deixar isso acontecer.
Now that I'm thinking about it, I heard a nasty rumor about her.=Agora que estou pensando nisso, ouvi um rumor desagradável sobre ela.
Apparently, she has a... "secret hobby."=Aparentemente, ela tem um... "hobby secreto."
Something dangerous. Something she could get in big trouble for.=Algo perigoso. Algo que poderia lhe causar grandes problemas.
It might be worth it to follow her around school and learn what she's hiding.=Pode ser interessante seguir ela pela escola e descobrir o que ela está escondendo.
Perhaps I can find a way to make her bad habits backfire on her.=Talvez eu possa encontrar uma maneira de fazer os hábitos ruins dela se voltarem contra ela.
You know what they say...=Você sabe o que dizem...
...you play with fire, and you get burned.=... "quem brinca com fogo se queima."
第３週
...my sweet, wonderful Senpai...=...meu doce e maravilhoso Senpai...
...is too popular for his own good.=...é popular demais para o seu próprio bem.
Yet another girl has been getting a little too close to him lately.=Mais uma garota tem se aproximado demais dele ultimamente.
She's a shy, timid little bookworm.=Ela é uma pequena ratinha de biblioteca tímida e medrosa.
When a guy sees that type of girl...=Quando um cara vê esse tipo de garota...
...he just wants to scoop her up in his arms and protect her, right?=...ele só quer pegá-la no colo e protegê-la, certo?
...it makes me sick.=...isso me deixa doente.
I need to get rid of her as soon as possible...=Eu preciso me livrar dela o mais rápido possível...
...but if her death is an obvious murder, it might complicate things.=...mas se a morte dela for um assassinato óbvio, isso pode complicar as coisas.
If I do decide to kill her... perhaps I should make it look like an accident.=Se eu decidir matá-la... talvez eu deva fazer parecer um acidente.
The only thing I know about this girl is that she loves books.=A única coisa que eu sei sobre essa garota é que ela ama livros.
It sure would be a shame if the one thing she loves the most...=Seria uma pena se a única coisa que ela mais ama...
...is what leads to her tragic, untimely demise.=...fosse o que levasse à sua trágica e prematura morte.
Before she can crush my dreams...=Antes que ela possa esmagar meus sonhos...
...I need to crush HER.=...eu preciso esmagá-LA.
第４週
My Senpai is perfect in every way...=Meu Senpai é perfeito em todos os aspectos...
He's smart... talented... handsome...=Ele é inteligente... talentoso... bonito...
...so I suppose I shouldn't be surprised that another girl has fallen for him.=...então eu suponho que não deveria me surpreender que outra garota tenha se apaixonado por ele.
This one is an aspiring athlete.=Essa é uma atleta aspirante.
Fit. Tan. Toned abs.=Em forma. Bronzeada. Barriga tonificada.
Boys go crazy for that type of girl, don't they?=Os meninos enlouquecem por esse tipo de garota, não é?
She worries me. I'll need to take her out quickly.=Ela me preocupa. Eu preciso me livrar dela rapidamente.
She seems to be encouraging my Senpai to adopt her lifestyle choices...=Ela parece estar incentivando meu Senpai a adotar suas escolhas de estilo de vida...
Eat healthy. Exercise often. No smoking or drinking.=Coma saudável. Exercite-se frequentemente. Sem fumar ou beber.
Of course, all of these are respectable decisions...=Claro, todas essas são decisões respeitáveis...
...but she's actually putting her health in grave danger...=...mas ela está colocando a saúde dela em grande perigo...
...by getting between me and the man I love.=...por se intrometer entre mim e o homem que eu amo.
I heard that she prepares a special meal in the Home Ec room every day.=Eu ouvi que ela prepara uma refeição especial na sala de Educação Doméstica todos os dias.
A healthy, nutritious meal packed full of vitamins and minerals.=Uma refeição saudável e nutritiva cheia de vitaminas e minerais.
I hope she chokes on it.=Espero que ela engasgue com isso.

第５週
Like an insect buzzing around a meal that was left unattended...=Como um inseto zumbindo em torno de uma refeição que foi deixada de lado...
...another pest has begun to orbit around my Senpai.=...mais uma praga começou a orbitar em torno do meu Senpai.
The latest girl comes from one of Japan's wealthiest families.=A mais nova garota vem de uma das famílias mais ricas do Japão.
She looks down on anyone with less money than her...=Ela menospreza qualquer um que tenha menos dinheiro do que ela...
...which, of course, means that she looks down on nearly everyone.=...o que, claro, significa que ela menospreza quase todo mundo.
I can tell that she doesn't see my Senpai as an equal...=Eu consigo perceber que ela não vê meu Senpai como um igual...
...it would be more accurate to say that she wants to keep him as a "pet."=...seria mais preciso dizer que ela quer mantê-lo como um "animal de estimação."
I'd like to say that my Senpai has enough sense to avoid getting involved with her...=Eu gostaria de dizer que meu Senpai tem juízo suficiente para evitar se envolver com ela...
...but the promise of a cozy life in the lap of luxury might be too tempting for him.=...mas a promessa de uma vida confortável no colo do luxo pode ser tentadora demais para ele.
Just to make sure that he doesn't make the wrong decision...=Só para garantir que ele não tome a decisão errada...
...I'll have to remove the option from his life altogether.=...eu terei que remover essa opção da vida dele completamente.
It looks like the only reason she enrolled in Akademi was for the prestige...=Parece que a única razão pela qual ela se inscreveu na Akademi foi pelo prestígio...
She has no intention of studying at all. She spends all day sunbathing at the pool.=Ela não tem intenção de estudar. Passa o dia todo tomando sol na piscina.
You know... every year... a lot of unfortunate accidents happen around pools...=Você sabe... todo ano... muitos acidentes infelizes acontecem ao redor das piscinas...
It would be such a shame if she fell asleep and drowned...=Seria uma pena se ela adormecesse e se afogasse...
第６週
I can't take my eyes off my Senpai for even one moment...=Eu não posso tirar os olhos do meu Senpai nem por um momento...
...because there's always a new girl trying to steal him from me.=...porque sempre há uma nova garota tentando roubá-lo de mim.
This week, my rival is a girl who dreams of becoming a pop idol.=Esta semana, minha rival é uma garota que sonha em se tornar uma pop idol.
She spent so many years of her life learning how to sing and dance...=Ela passou tantos anos da vida aprendendo a cantar e dançar...
...what a shame that all her efforts will go to waste.=Que pena que todos os seus esforços vão acabar em vão.
Bubbly, full of energy, always smiling...=Eufórica, cheia de energia, sempre sorrindo...
...guys can't resist that type of girl, can they?=Os caras não conseguem resistir a esse tipo de garota, conseguem?
I definitely can't ignore this one.=Eu definitivamente não posso ignorar essa.
I need to deal with her... and quickly.=Eu preciso lidar com ela... e rápido.
She set up a stage in the school gym where she rehearses her cute little songs.=Ela montou um palco na ginásio da escola onde ensaia suas músicas fofinhas.
Microphones... speakers... all those wires and cables...=Microfones... alto-falantes... todos aqueles fios e cabos...
...there's got to be an opportunity in there somewhere.=Deve haver uma oportunidade por aqui em algum lugar.
She wants to captivate an audience, does she?=Ela quer cativar um público, não é?
Well, I should lend her a hand...=Bem, eu deveria dar uma mãozinha a ela...
...and help her give a shocking performance.=...e ajudar a dar uma apresentação chocante.
第７週
Many girls have competed for my Senpai's heart.=Muitas garotas competiram pelo coração do meu Senpai.
Most of them were mere pests rather than actual threats...=A maioria delas eram meras pragas, e não ameaças reais...
...but the latest one is different.=...mas a mais nova é diferente.
Akademi's top student. The brightest girl in school.=A melhor aluna da Akademi. A garota mais brilhante da escola.
Perfect scores on every test. Flawless grades in every subject.=Notas perfeitas em todos os testes. Notas impecáveis em todas as disciplinas.
The perfect combination of beauty and brains.=A combinação perfeita de beleza e inteligência.
Any guy at school would be honored to have her attention.=Qualquer garoto da escola ficaria honrado em ter a atenção dela.
If she continues to spend time around my Senpai...=Se ela continuar passando tempo com meu Senpai...
...there is no doubt that she'll steal him from me.=...não há dúvida de que ela vai roubá-lo de mim.
...there is no doubt that she'll steal him away from me.=...não há dúvida de que ela vai tirá-lo de mim.
It feels like I've been seeing the police patrolling near Akademi more often lately.=Parece que tenho visto a polícia patrulhando perto da Akademi com mais frequência ultimamente.
The unsolved murder from earlier this year is still a stain on their reputation.=O assassinato não resolvido do início deste ano ainda é uma mancha na reputação deles.
Any bloodshed at this point in time could attract unwanted attention...=Qualquer derramamento de sangue neste momento pode atrair atenção indesejada...
...perhaps I should keep my hands clean from now on.=...talvez eu deva manter as mãos limpas a partir de agora.
Hmm... Akademi's top student...=Hmm... a melhor aluna da Akademi...
...it sure would be a shame if she was expelled from school, wouldn't it?=Seria uma pena se ela fosse expulsa da escola, não seria?
第８週
Yamato nadeshiko.=Yamato nadeshiko.
It's a phrase that refers to the traditional Japanese concept of the "ideal woman."=É uma expressão que se refere ao conceito tradicional japonês da "mulher ideal."
A woman who is pure and feminine.=Uma mulher que é pura e feminina.
Gentle, graceful, humble, patient, faithful...=Gentil, graciosa, humilde, paciente, fiel...
Meek. Quiet. Timid.=Mansa. Silenciosa. Tímida.
Keep the house clean. Bear lots of children. Respect your husband no matter what.=Mantenha a casa limpa. Tenha muitos filhos. Respeite seu marido, não importa o que aconteça.
Know your place.=Saiba o seu lugar.
Yamato nadeshiko.=Yamato nadeshiko.
It's often said that this type of woman is going extinct...=Dizem frequentemente que esse tipo de mulher está indo à extinção...
...that it's rare to find a woman who embodies those traits in this day and age.=...que é raro encontrar uma mulher que personifique essas características nos dias de hoje.
But, there's one girl at Akademi who fits that description perfectly.=Mas, há uma garota na Akademi que se encaixa perfeitamente nessa descrição.
The most popular girl in school. Every boy wants her. Every girl wants to be her.=A garota mais popular da escola. Todos os meninos a querem. Todas as meninas querem ser ela.
Even my Senpai has fallen under her spell.=Até meu Senpai se deixou levar por seu encanto.
Well, it's time to break the spell that this witch has cast over the school.=Bem, é hora de quebrar o feitiço que essa bruxa lançou sobre a escola.
I'd like to stain her perfect reputation... and turn her adoring fans into her enemies.=Eu gostaria de manchar sua reputação perfeita... e transformar seus fãs adoradores em inimigos.

Sometimes, when I'm following my Senpai home from school...=Às vezes, quando estou seguindo meu Senpai para casa depois da escola...  
...I notice that he likes to buy certain magazines from convenience stores.=...eu percebo que ele gosta de comprar certas revistas em lojas de conveniência.  
Magazines featuring... "gravure idols."=Revistas que apresentam... "ídolos gravure."
Attractive young women who strike provocative poses in revealing outfits.=Mulheres jovens e atraentes que fazem poses provocantes com roupas reveladoras.
He's a big fan of one girl in particular.=Ele é um grande fã de uma garota em particular.  
Since her debut, he's bought every magazine with even a single photo of her.=Desde a estreia dela, ele comprou todas as revistas que têm pelo menos uma foto dela.  
And...=E...  
...she just transferred into Akademi.=...ela acabou de se transferir para a Akademi.  
Most of the school's male population are already completely infatuated with her...=A maior parte da população masculina da escola já está completamente encantada por ela...  
They follow her around school like a pack of pathetic, lovesick puppy dogs...=Eles a seguem pela escola como um bando de patéticos cães apaixonados...  
...and my Senpai is among them.=...e meu Senpai é um deles.  
As much as I'd love to carve a hole in her heart...=Por mais que eu adorasse abrir um buraco em seu coração...  
...it might be difficult with so many witnesses surrounding her at all times.=...pode ser difícil com tantos testemunhas ao redor dela o tempo todo.  
Perhaps the best way to deal with her is to set her up with another boy...=Talvez a melhor maneira de lidar com ela seja juntá-la com outro garoto...  
...after all, it's not like it's going to be difficult to find a volunteer.=...afinal, não parece que será difícil encontrar um voluntário.  
第10週  
...I've been trying to avoid acknowledging him, but...=...eu tenho tentado evitar reconhecê-lo, mas...  
...at this point in time, that's just not possible anymore.=...neste momento, isso já não é mais possível.  
The man in the trenchcoat. The... investigative journalist.=O homem de trench coat. O... jornalista investigativo.  
He finally made his move.=Ele finalmente fez seu movimento.  
For months now, he's been obsessed with investigating Akademi...=Há meses, ele está obcecado em investigar a Akademi...  
...but the headmaster has always refused him entry into the school.=...mas o diretor sempre se recusou a deixá-lo entrar na escola.  
Up until now, that was enough to stop him. But, recently...=Até agora, isso foi suficiente para detê-lo. Mas, recentemente...  
...he found a loophole.=...ele encontrou uma brecha.  
Apparently, he's had an "apprentice" for a while now. She's a junior detective...=Aparentemente, ele teve uma "aprendiz" por um tempo. Ela é uma detetive júnior...  
...and a former student of Akademi.=...e uma ex-aluna da Akademi.  
Back when she was attending school here, she did something extraordinary...=Quando ela estava na escola aqui, ela fez algo extraordinário...  
...she solved a high-profile murder mystery that the police were struggling with.=...ela resolveu um mistério de assassinato de alto perfil que a polícia estava tendo dificuldades para solucionar.  
That accomplishment turned her into a national celebrity almost overnight.=Esse feito a transformou em uma celebridade nacional quase da noite para o dia.  
There was nothing more for her to gain from remaining enrolled in Akademi, so...=Não havia mais nada a ganhar permanecendo matriculada na Akademi, então...  
...she left without graduating, and quickly began a career as a junior detective.=...ela saiu sem se formar e rapidamente começou uma carreira como detetive júnior.  
And now, one year later... she's back.=E agora, um ano depois... ela está de volta.  
She claims that she's here to finish her degree...=Ela afirma que está aqui para terminar seu diploma...  
...but I can tell that there's more to the story than that.=...mas eu sei que há mais nessa história do que isso.  
Her mentor - that journalist - is firmly determined to investigate Akademi...=Seu mentor - aquele jornalista - está firmemente determinado a investigar a Akademi...  
...clearly, he must have asked his apprentice to return here to be his eyes and ears.=...claramente, ele deve ter pedido a sua aprendiz para voltar aqui para ser seus olhos e ouvidos.  
The two of them have been interviewing students, and they've learned something:=Os dois têm entrevistado alunos e aprenderam algo:  
Things tend to happen to girls who have a crush on a certain boy at school...=Coisas tendem a acontecer com garotas que estão apaixonadas por um certo garoto na escola...  
...my Senpai.=...meu Senpai.  
He's become a "person of interest" to them...=Ele se tornou uma "pessoa de interesse" para eles...  
...and now, that junior detective girl is investigating him.=...e agora, aquela garota detetive júnior está investigando-o.  
Following him everywhere... talking to him all the time...=Seguindo-o por toda parte... falando com ele o tempo todo...  
...and lately, she's been getting a bit too friendly with him.=...e ultimamente, ela tem se tornado um pouco amigável demais com ele.  
...it's enough to make my blood boil.=...isso é o suficiente para me deixar furiosa.  
But, as much as I would love to sink a knife into her heart...=Mas, por mais que eu adorasse enfiar uma faca em seu coração...  
...a violent approach might be a bad decision this time around.=...uma abordagem violenta pode não ser uma boa decisão desta vez.  
She's convinced a bunch of students to patrol the hallways with cameras...=Ela convenceu um grupo de alunos a patrulhar os corredores com câmeras...  
...right now, the slightest mistake could cost me everything.=...neste momento, o menor erro poderia me custar tudo.  
This girl... she's probably the most dangerous enemy I've faced so far...=Essa garota... ela é provavelmente a inimiga mais perigosa que enfrentei até agora...  
...but... if I could somehow manage to befriend her and put her in debt to me... =...mas... se eu conseguisse de alguma forma me tornar amiga dela e fazê-la ficar em dívida comigo...  
...she could be a powerful ally.=...ela poderia ser uma aliada poderosa.  

ラスト
The past eleven weeks have challenged me in every way possible...=As últimas onze semanas me desafiaram de todas as maneiras possíveis...  
...but, despite everything, I've still managed to defeat every one of my adversaries.=...mas, apesar de tudo, consegui derrotar cada um dos meus adversários.  
These experiences have made me stronger. Braver.=Essas experiências me tornaram mais forte. Mais corajosa.  
I think... I've finally found the courage to talk to him...=Eu acho... que finalmente encontrei coragem para falar com ele...  
...to tell him how I feel.=...para contar a ele como me sinto.  
When I confess my feelings to him... it has to be special... it has to be perfect!=Quando eu confessar meus sentimentos a ele... tem que ser especial... tem que ser perfeito!  
I don't believe in the myth about the cherry tree behind the school...=Eu não acredito no mito sobre a árvore de cerejeira atrás da escola...  
...but I can't think of any place more appropriate for my confession.=...mas não consigo pensar em lugar mais apropriado para minha confissão.  
Today... I'm going to tell him today.=Hoje... eu vou contar a ele hoje.  
Senpai... please accept my feelings!=Senpai... por favor, aceite meus sentimentos!  

新聞
Hello, students of Akademi! This is Shinako Bunzai, the President of the Newspaper Club, bringing you the very first issue of Akademi Daily!\n\nEvery day, the latest edition of our newspaper will be posted here for all to see. We have five writers - including myself - dedicated to bringing you the latest news!\n\nMy column, "Our School," will be all about the wonderful institution you're standing in right now - Akademi! Check back every day for interesting facts and trivia about this fine center of education!\n\nI'm looking forward to sharing a wonderful school year with you all!=Olá, alunos da Akademi! Sou Shinako Bunzai, a Presidente do Clube de Jornalismo, trazendo a vocês a primeira edição do Akademi Daily!\n\nTodos os dias, a edição mais recente do nosso jornal será postada aqui para todos verem. Temos cinco escritores - incluindo eu mesma - dedicados a trazer as últimas notícias!\n\nMinha coluna, "Nossa Escola", será sobre a maravilhosa instituição em que vocês estão agora - Akademi! Voltem todos os dias para conferir fatos e curiosidades interessantes sobre este excelente centro de educação!\n\nEstou ansiosa para compartilhar um ano escolar maravilhoso com todos vocês!
Hello, students of Akademi! This is Jiichiro Takahashi, the President of the Newspaper Club, bringing you the very first issue of Akademi Daily!\n\nEvery day, the latest edition of our newspaper will be posted here for all to see. We have five writers - including myself - dedicated to bringing you the latest news!\n\nMy column, "Our School," will be all about the wonderful institution you're standing in right now - Akademi! Check back every day for interesting facts and trivia about this fine center of education!\n\nI'm looking forward to sharing a wonderful school year with you all!=Olá, alunos da Akademi! Sou Jiichiro Takahashi, o Presidente do Clube de Jornalismo, trazendo a vocês a primeira edição do Akademi Daily!\n\nTodos os dias, a edição mais recente do nosso jornal será postada aqui para todos verem. Temos cinco escritores - incluindo eu mesmo - dedicados a trazer as últimas notícias!\n\nMinha coluna, "Nossa Escola", será sobre a maravilhosa instituição em que vocês estão agora - Akademi! Voltem todos os dias para conferir fatos e curiosidades interessantes sobre este excelente centro de educação!\n\nEstou ansioso para compartilhar um ano escolar maravilhoso com todos vocês!
As promised, I'm here to share some fascinating trivia about our school with you! Today's column is all about the origin of the school!\n\nIchiko Saikou, the heiress to Saikou Corp, had many terrible experiences during high school. Her father, Saisho Saikou, was heartbroken to see his daughter so sad...so, he came up with a plan.\n\nHe wanted to give his daughter a way to re-live high school, but he also wanted her to continue her education. So, he paid for the construction of an academy that is meant to resemble a high school!\n\nAnd that's why Akademi, a post-high school academy, resembles high school so much!=Como prometido, estou aqui para compartilhar algumas curiosidades fascinantes sobre nossa escola com vocês! A coluna de hoje é sobre a origem da escola!\n\nIchiko Saikou, a herdeira da Saikou Corp, teve muitas experiências terríveis durante o ensino médio. Seu pai, Saisho Saikou, ficou de coração partido ao ver sua filha tão triste... então, ele teve uma ideia.\n\nEle queria dar à filha uma maneira de reviver o ensino médio, mas também queria que ela continuasse sua educação. Então, ele pagou pela construção de uma academia que foi projetada para se parecer com um ensino médio!\n\nE é por isso que a Akademi, uma academia pós-ensino médio, se parece tanto com o ensino médio!
Saisho Saikou wanted to give his daughter the perfect "high school experience", so he tailored the school to her exact tastes. The location, color scheme, layout, and uniforms were all chosen by her!\n\nIchiko loves the countryside, so Akademi was built in a rural area. Ichiko's favorite colors are white and gold, which is why Akademi has a white and gold color scheme.\n\nIchiko loves symmetry, so the school building has a square shape. Ichiko adores middle-school uniforms, so we wear "sailor" uniforms instead of blazers here.\n\nAbsolutely every aspect of Akademi was designed to please Ichiko! It was built to be her paradise!=Saisho Saikou queria proporcionar à filha a experiência de ensino médio perfeita, então ele ajustou a escola aos seus gostos exatos. A localização, esquema de cores, layout e uniformes foram todos escolhidos por ela!\n\nIchiko adora o campo, então a Akademi foi construída em uma área rural. As cores favoritas de Ichiko são branco e dourado, por isso a Akademi tem um esquema de cores branco e dourado.\n\nIchiko adora simetria, então o edifício da escola tem um formato quadrado. Ichiko adora uniformes de escola fundamental, então usamos uniformes "marinheiro" em vez de blazers aqui.\n\nAbsolutamente todos os aspectos da Akademi foram projetados para agradar a Ichiko! Foi construída para ser o paraíso dela!
Akademi was built for Ichiko, and she graduated from the school earlier this year...but, even though the school has finished serving its original purpose, Saikou Corp found a new use for it!\n\nSaikou Corp decided to market Akademi as a school for high school graduates who want to continue their education in an setting that simulates the feeling of a high school environment!\n\nYou must be at least 18 years old in order to apply for enrollment at Akademi...but, if you're accepted, you can choose to be a first-year, second-year, or third-year!\n\nI wonder why YOU chose to enroll at Akademi? For the education, or for the high school atmosphere?=A Akademi foi construída para Ichiko, e ela se formou na escola no início deste ano... mas, mesmo que a escola tenha cumprido seu propósito original, a Saikou Corp encontrou um novo uso para ela!\n\nA Saikou Corp decidiu comercializar a Akademi como uma escola para graduados do ensino médio que querem continuar sua educação em um ambiente que simula a sensação de um ambiente de ensino médio!\n\nVocê deve ter pelo menos 18 anos para se inscrever na Akademi... mas, se for aceito, você pode escolher ser um calouro, segundo ano ou terceiro ano!\n\nEu me pergunto por que VOCÊ decidiu se inscrever na Akademi? Pela educação ou pela atmosfera de ensino médio?
The last piece of trivia that I'll share with you this week is about Akademi's namesake! We have to go way back in time for this one!\n\nWhen Ichiko Saikou was a young child, she heard a bedtime story about a school for young witches and wizards called "the Akademi Institute." For years, Ichiko was absolutely fascinated by that story!\n\nSo, of course, when it came time to name the school, Saisho Saikou knew exactly what to name it - "Akademi Academy!"\n\nSaying the school's name feels like saying the same word twice, so most people just say "Akademi."=A última curiosidade que vou compartilhar com vocês esta semana é sobre a origem do nome Akademi! Precisamos voltar bastante no tempo para isso!\n\nQuando Ichiko Saikou era uma criança pequena, ela ouviu uma história antes de dormir sobre uma escola para jovens bruxos e bruxas chamada "Instituto Akademi." Por anos, Ichiko ficou absolutamente fascinada por essa história!\n\nEntão, é claro, quando chegou a hora de nomear a escola, Saisho Saikou sabia exatamente como nomeá-la - "Akademi Academy!"\n\nDizer o nome da escola parece dizer a mesma palavra duas vezes, então a maioria das pessoas apenas diz "Akademi."

Akademi is a prestigious institute of higher learning, and all students are expected to dress appropriately. No dyed hair, no makeup, no piercings, no fashion accessories! ...with that said, you may have noticed that some of your classmates appear to be in direct violation of those policies.\n\nDon't worry; there IS a logical explanation! In order to incentivise students to study hard, the headmaster has come up with a rather creative policy: Students with exceptionally high grades are allowed to bend the rules a bit, in regards to the dress code.\n\nIf you're one of the top students in class, you're permitted to wear one hair accessory, or wear colored socks (as long as they are no higher than your knee). You are also given the option of wearing thigh-high stockings, as long as the stockings are solid black or solid white.\n\nNow, with all of that said, it's worth mentioning that there are a few students at school who are exceptions to this rule. In the next edition of Akademi Daily, I'll tackle that subject head-on!=Akademi é uma prestigiada instituição de ensino superior, e todos os alunos são esperados a se vestir adequadamente. Nada de cabelo tingido, maquiagem, piercings ou acessórios de moda! ... dito isso, você pode ter notado que alguns dos seus colegas parecem estar em violação direta dessas políticas.\n\nNão se preocupe; há uma explicação lógica! Para incentivar os alunos a estudarem muito, o diretor criou uma política bastante criativa: Alunos com notas excepcionalmente altas são autorizados a flexibilizar um pouco as regras em relação ao código de vestimenta.\n\nSe você for um dos melhores alunos da turma, é permitido usar um acessório de cabelo, ou usar meias coloridas (desde que não sejam mais altas que o seu joelho). Você também tem a opção de usar meias até a coxa, desde que as meias sejam completamente pretas ou completamente brancas.\n\nAgora, com tudo isso dito, vale mencionar que há alguns alunos na escola que são exceções a essa regra. Na próxima edição do Akademi Daily, eu abordarei esse assunto de frente!
You may have noticed that some of your classmates are sporting flamboyant hairstyles and open shirts, or streaks of dyed hair and long skirts. You may have also noticed that those same students tend to walk around with long blunt objects equipped on their backs.\n\nI know what you're thinking! "What's up with all the delinquents at this school?! I thought that Akademi was supposed to be an elite school for the brightest young minds in the country!" Well, you're certainly not wrong about that... but there's one more detail you may be forgetting!\n\nAs I explained in an article last week, Akademi is meant to simulate a high school environment and allow students to "re-live" high school while getting a genuine education. If there are students who wish to pay the tuition fee purely so they can "roleplay" as delinquents, then... so be it!\n\nAkademi has adopted a strict "No harm, no foul" policy towards the school's "delinquent" population. As long as they don't hurt anyone, they're free to roleplay however they'd like to.=Você pode ter notado que alguns dos seus colegas estão com penteados chamativos e camisas abertas, ou com mechas de cabelo tingido e saias longas. Você também pode ter notado que esses mesmos alunos tendem a andar com objetos longos e contundentes nas costas.\n\nEu sei o que você está pensando! "Qual é a com todos esses delinquentes nesta escola?! Eu pensei que a Akademi deveria ser uma escola de elite para as mentes mais brilhantes do país!" Bem, você certamente não está errado sobre isso... mas há um detalhe a mais que você pode estar esquecendo!\n\nComo expliquei em um artigo na semana passada, a Akademi é destinada a simular um ambiente de ensino médio e permitir que os alunos "revivam" o ensino médio enquanto recebem uma educação genuína. Se há alunos que desejam pagar a mensalidade apenas para "encenar" como delinquentes, então... que assim seja!\n\nA Akademi adotou uma política rigorosa de "Sem dano, sem falta" em relação à população "delinquente" da escola. Desde que não machuquem ninguém, eles são livres para encenar como quiserem.
Whoops! Sorry, this article is coming in a future update.=Ops! Desculpe, este artigo virá em uma atualização futura.



Up until now, the position of "Librarian" has been vacant here at Akademi. Tragically, not a single student was interested in volunteering to watch over the school's library. However, as of today, that has finally changed!\n\nHonami Hodoshima was absent for the past two weeks because of illness, but now that she's made a full recovery, she has returned to us here at Akademi! There is nothing that Honami loves more than books and reading, so, from today onwards, she will be filling the position of librarian!\n\nSadly, the library rarely recieves any visitors. That just breaks my heart! I don't want poor Honami to be lonely in there! For at least one week, will some of you students try to spend a little more time in the library? Please?\n\nI can't believe that we live in a society where some people would rather hold a handheld video game console than hold a book! It's a shame what our world is turning into...=Até agora, a posição de "Bibliotecário" estava vaga aqui na Akademi. Tragicamente, nenhum aluno se interessou em se voluntariar para cuidar da biblioteca da escola. No entanto, a partir de hoje, isso finalmente mudou!\n\nHonami Hodoshima esteve ausente nas últimas duas semanas devido a uma doença, mas agora que ela se recuperou completamente, ela voltou para nós aqui na Akademi! Não há nada que Honami ame mais do que livros e leitura, então, a partir de hoje, ela assumirá a posição de bibliotecária!\n\nInfelizmente, a biblioteca raramente recebe visitantes. Isso parte meu coração! Eu não quero que a pobre Honami fique sozinha lá dentro! Por pelo menos uma semana, algum de vocês alunos poderia tentar passar um pouco mais de tempo na biblioteca? Por favor?\n\nEu não posso acreditar que vivemos em uma sociedade onde algumas pessoas preferem segurar um console de videogame portátil do que segurar um livro! É uma pena o que nosso mundo está se tornando...
Up until now, the position of "Librarian" has been vacant here at Akademi. Tragically, not a single student was interested in volunteering to watch over the school's library. However, as of today, that has finally changed!\n\nHonami Hodoshima was absent for the past two weeks because of illness, but now that she's made a full recovery, she has returned to us here at Akademi! There is nothing that Honami loves more than books and reading, so, from today onwards, she will be filling the position of librarian!\n\nSadly, the library rarely recieves any visitors. That just breaks my heart! I don't want poor Honami to be lonely in there! For at least one week, will some of you students try to spend a little more time in the library? Please?\n\nI can't believe that we live in a society where some people would rather hold a handheld video game console than hold a book! It's a shame what our world is turning into...=Até agora, a posição de "Bibliotecário" estava vaga aqui na Akademi. Tragicamente, nenhum aluno se interessou em se voluntariar para cuidar da biblioteca da escola. No entanto, a partir de hoje, isso finalmente mudou!\n\nHonami Hodoshima esteve ausente nas últimas duas semanas devido a uma doença, mas agora que ela se recuperou completamente, ela voltou para nós aqui na Akademi! Não há nada que Honami ame mais do que livros e leitura, então, a partir de hoje, ela assumirá a posição de bibliotecária!\n\nInfelizmente, a biblioteca raramente recebe visitantes. Isso parte meu coração! Eu não quero que a pobre Honami fique sozinha lá dentro! Por pelo menos uma semana, algum de vocês alunos poderia tentar passar um pouco mais de tempo na biblioteca? Por favor?\n\nEu não posso acreditar que vivemos em uma sociedade onde algumas pessoas preferem segurar um console de videogame portátil do que segurar um livro! É uma pena o que nosso mundo está se tornando...




I've got news for you! Akademi's star athlete, Sumiko Tachibana, has finally returned to us! She was absent for the past 3 weeks to participate in a grueling training regimen that left zero room in her life for school - but now she's back!\n\nSumiko achieved a lot of fame last year for out-performing the school's male population at nearly every physical activity. A lot of students expect to see her at the Olympics one day, earning a gold medal in the name of Japan!\n\nSumiko seems like she would be the ideal candidate to be the president of the sports club, but despite her proficiency at sports, she prefers to remain clubless. That might seem peculiar, but trust me, there's a good reason for it! Sumiko is far too polite to ever say it out loud, but...\n\nEveryone knows the reason she remains clubless is because the rest of the club would just slow her down. Yes, she's just THAT much stronger and faster than everyone else!=Tenho uma novidade para vocês! A estrela esportiva da Akademi, Sumiko Tachibana, finalmente retornou! Ela esteve ausente nas últimas 3 semanas para participar de um regime de treinamento extenuante que não deixou espaço em sua vida para a escola - mas agora ela está de volta!\n\nSumiko alcançou muita fama no ano passado por superar a população masculina da escola em quase todas as atividades físicas. Muitos alunos esperam vê-la nas Olimpíadas um dia, conquistando uma medalha de ouro em nome do Japão!\n\nSumiko parece ser a candidata ideal para ser a presidente do clube de esportes, mas apesar de sua proficiência em esportes, ela prefere permanecer sem clube. Isso pode parecer peculiar, mas confiem em mim, há um bom motivo para isso! Sumiko é educada demais para dizer isso em voz alta, mas...\n\nTodo mundo sabe que o motivo pelo qual ela permanece sem clube é porque o resto do clube só a desaceleraria. Sim, ela é simplesmente MUITO mais forte e rápida do que todo mundo!




A new student has enrolled into Akademi today - Ritsuko Chikanari, heiress to Chikanari Industries, the corporation that is famous for being the supplier of the raw materials that Saikou Corp uses in most of its electronic devices.\n\nNow, Akademi Daily is not a trashy gossip rag, so I would NEVER say something like, “Allegedly, Ritsuko's test scores were way too low for her to pass Akademi's entrance exams, so her father bribed the headmaster to let her enroll in Akademi." I would never say that.\n\nI would ALSO never say something like, “Allegedly, Ritsuko has absolutely zero intention of doing a single piece of schoolwork during her stay at Akademi, and has openly stated that she intends to just sunbathe at the pool all day long until she graduates." I would never, ever say that.\n\nBy the way, I'd like to remind you that the views expressed within this column do not reflect the opinions or views of Akademi or its faculty!=本日よりAkademi校に入学したRitsuko Chikanariさんは、Saikou社に電子機器の原材料を供給していることで有名なChikanari工業の跡取り娘です。\n\nさて、アカデミ・デイリーはゴミ屑のようなゴシップ紙ではないので、”Ritsukoさんは入学試験の点数が低すぎてAkademi校に入学できなそうなので、彼女の父親が校長に賄賂を渡すことで入学した”という噂話を決して書きません。絶対にそんなことは書きません。\n\nまた、”RitsukoさんはAkademi校にいる間は学業をする気は全く無く、卒業するまで一日中プールで日光浴して過ごすことを公言した”という噂話も決して書きません。絶対にそんな事書きません。\n\nなお、今回のコラム内で述べられている見解は、Akademi校やその教員の意見・見解を反映するものではないことを断っておきます！
A new student has enrolled into Akademi today - Ritsuko Chikanari, heiress to Chikanari Industries, the corporation that is famous for being the supplier of the raw materials that Saikou Corp uses in most of its electronic devices.\n\nNow, Akademi Daily is not a trashy gossip rag, so I would NEVER say something like, "Allegedly, Ritsuko's test scores were way too low for her to pass Akademi's entrance exams, so her father bribed the headmaster to let her enroll in Akademi." I would never say that.\n\nI would ALSO never say something like, "Allegedly, Ritsuko has absolutely zero intention of doing a single piece of schoolwork during her stay at Akademi, and has openly stated that she intends to just sunbathe at the pool all day long until she graduates." I would never, ever say that.\n\nBy the way, I'd like to remind you that the views expressed within this column do not reflect the opinions or views of Akademi or its faculty!=本日よりAkademi校に入学したRitsuko Chikanariさんは、Saikou社に電子機器の原材料を供給していることで有名なChikanari工業の跡取り娘です。\n\nさて、アカデミ・デイリーはゴミ屑のようなゴシップ紙ではないので、”Ritsukoさんは入学試験の点数が低すぎてAkademi校に入学できなそうなので、彼女の父親が校長に賄賂を渡すことで入学した”という噂話を決して書きません。絶対にそんなことは書きません。\n\nまた、”RitsukoさんはAkademi校にいる間は学業をする気は全く無く、卒業するまで一日中プールで日光浴して過ごすことを公言した”という噂話も決して書きません。絶対にそんな事書きません。\n\nなお、今回のコラム内で述べられている見解は、Akademi校やその教員の意見・見解を反映するものではないことを断っておきます！





A new student has enrolled into Akademi today - Ai Doruyashi! Ai has made it absolutely no secret that she has a big dream - she wants to be a star! A pop idol, in fact! Well, I, for one, wish her luck achieving her dreams!\n\nAi works fast; she has already constructed a stage in the school gym where she intends to spend a week rehearsing the song that she will sing for her debut! I've heard that the light Music Club will be providing the instrumental. How exciting!\n\nEven though Ai has only just enrolled here, I've already heard someone trying to spread a rather distasteful rumor about her! The accusation is that Ai only enrolled at Akademi because she thinks that being "the idol who studied at Akademi" is fastest way to launch her career as an idol.\n\nIt's incredibly cruel to say something so mean about a young girl who is just chasing her dreams! Please be nice to Ai,and drop by the school gym if you'd like to see her practice a performance!=本日、Akademi校にAi Doruyashiさんが転校してきました！Aiさんには、スター歌手になりたいという大きな夢があります！私個人としては、彼女の夢が叶うことを祈ってます！\n\nAiさんは早くも学校の体育館に特設ステージを設け、1週間かけてデビュー曲のリハーサルを行う予定です！楽器などは軽音楽部が提供する予定です。とてもワクワクしますね！\n\nAiさんは転校したばかりですが、既に何者かが彼女の悪い噂を広げようとしています！噂によればAiさんがAkademi校に転校したのは、「Akademi校で学んだアイドル」という肩書が、アイドルとしてのキャリアを上り詰める一番の近道だと考えたからだというのです。\n\n夢を追っているだけの少女にそんな意地悪な事を言うなんて、信じられないくらい残酷です！皆様、ぜひAiさんと仲良くしてあげてください。もしAiさんの練習風景に興味がある方は、ぜひ体育館に寄ってみてください！
A new student has enrolled into Akademi today - Ai Doruyashi! Ai has made it absolutely no secret that she has a big dream - she wants to be a star! A pop idol, in fact! Well, I, for one, wish her luck achieving her dreams!\n\nAi works fast; she has already constructed a stage in the school gym where she intends to spend a week rehearsing the song that she will sing for her debut! I've heard that the Light Music Club will be providing the instrumental. How exciting!\n\nEven though Ai has only just enrolled here, I've already heard someone trying to spread a rather distasteful rumor about her! The accusation is that Ai only enrolled at Akademi because she thinks that being "the idol who studied at Akademi" is fastest way to launch her career as an idol.\n\nIt's incredibly cruel to say something so mean about a young girl who is just chasing her dreams! Please be nice to Ai, and drop by the school gym if you'd like to see her practice a performance!=本日、Akademi校にAi Doruyashiさんが転校してきました！Aiさんには、スター歌手になりたいという大きな夢があります！私個人としては、彼女の夢が叶うことを祈ってます！\n\nAiさんは早くも学校の体育館に特設ステージを設け、1週間かけてデビュー曲のリハーサルを行う予定です！楽器などは軽音楽部が提供する予定です。とてもワクワクしますね！\n\nAiさんは転校したばかりですが、既に何者かが彼女の悪い噂を広げようとしています！噂によればAiさんがAkademi校に転校したのは、「Akademi校で学んだアイドル」という肩書が、アイドルとしてのキャリアを上り詰める一番の近道だと考えたからだというのです。\n\n夢を追っているだけの少女にそんな意地悪な事を言うなんて、信じられないくらい残酷です！皆様、ぜひAiさんと仲良くしてあげてください。もしAiさんの練習風景に興味がある方は、ぜひ体育館に寄ってみてください！





One of our most famous students - Teiko Nabatasai - has been absent for the past few weeks. I'm sure that most of you already know the reason why, but I'll remind you in case it slipped your mind: she was visiting a school abroad.\n\nNow, you might be thinking, "But I thought that Akademi was an elite school! Why would a student from Akademi study at a fo eign school?“ Oh, gentle reader, how mistaken you would be to have such thoughts. Teiko was not studying abroad; she was TEACHING abroad!\n\nThat's right; not only is Teiko fluent in multiple languages, she is also more qualified than some college professors to teach certain subjects! Another school was BEGGING to have Teiko visit them and deliver a few lectures. The headmaster authorized it, so Teiko hopped on a plane right away!\n\nYou might wonder what Teiko has left to learn here at Akademi if she's already smart enough to be a college professor. The answer is that she wants the "high school experience" that Akademi offers!=Akademi校で最も有名な学生の一人である、Teiko Nabatasaiさんはこの数週間欠席していました。ほとんどの人がその理由を御存知かと思いますが、念の為その理由を記載します。彼女は海外の学校へ留学していたのです。\n\nあなたは今、もしかしたらこう思ったかもしれません。「Akademi校はエリート校でしょ！なんでAkademi校の生徒が海外校で勉強するんだろう？」と。読者の皆さん、その考えは間違っています。Teikoさんは海外で勉強をしていたのではなく、教鞭をとっていたのです！\n\nTeikoさんは複数の言語を流暢に話せるだけでなく、特定の科目では大学教授よりも教育者としての素質があります！他校ではTeikoさんの来校と講義を切望していたほどです。校長はそれを承認し、Teikoさんはすぐさま飛行機に飛び乗りました！\n\nあなたはもしかすると、Teikoさんは大学教授になれるほど賢いのに、なぜAkademi校に在籍し続けていることに疑問を抱くかもしれません。その答えは、Akademi校が与えてくれる「高校生活体験」を彼女が欲しているからです！
One of our most famous students - Teiko Nabatashi - has been absent for the past few weeks. I'm sure that most of you already know the reason why, but I'll remind you in case it slipped your mind: she was visiting a school abroad.\n\nNow, you might be thinking, "But I thought that Akademi was an elite school! Why would a student from Akademi study at a foreign school?" Oh, gentle reader, how mistaken you would be to have such thoughts. Teiko was not studying abroad; she was TEACHING abroad!\n\nThat's right; not only is Teiko fluent in multiple languages, she is also more qualified than some college professors to teach certain subjects! Another school was BEGGING to have Teiko visit them and deliver a few lectures. The headmaster authorized it, so Teiko hopped on a plane right away!\n\nYou might wonder what Teiko has left to learn here at Akademi if she's already smart enough to be a college professor. The answer is that she wants the "high school experience" that Akademi offers!=Akademi校で最も有名な学生の一人である、Teiko Nabatasaiさんはこの数週間欠席していました。ほとんどの人がその理由を御存知かと思いますが、念の為その理由を記載します。彼女は海外の学校へ留学していたのです。\n\nあなたは今、もしかしたらこう思ったかもしれません。「Akademi校はエリート校でしょ！なんでAkademi校の生徒が海外校で勉強するんだろう？」と。読者の皆さん、その考えは間違っています。Teikoさんは海外で勉強をしていたのではなく、教鞭をとっていたのです！\n\nTeikoさんは複数の言語を流暢に話せるだけでなく、特定の科目では大学教授よりも教育者としての素質があります！他校ではTeikoさんの来校と講義を切望していたほどです。校長はそれを承認し、Teikoさんはすぐさま飛行機に飛び乗りました！\n\nあなたはもしかすると、Teikoさんは大学教授になれるほど賢いのに、なぜAkademi校に在籍し続けていることに疑問を抱くかもしれません。その答えは、Akademi校が与えてくれる「高校生活体験」を彼女が欲しているからです！
One of our most famous students - Teiko Nabatasai - has been absent for the past few weeks. I'm sure that most of you already know the reason why, but I'll remind you in case it slipped your mind: she was visiting a school abroad.\n\nNow, you might be thinking, "But I thought that Akademi was an elite school! Why would a student from Akademi study at a foreign school?" Oh, gentle reader, how mistaken you would be to have such thoughts. Teiko was not studying abroad; she was TEACHING abroad!\n\nThat's right; not only is Teiko fluent in multiple languages, she is also more qualified than some college professors to teach certain subjects! Another school was BEGGING to have Teiko visit them and deliver a few lectures. The headmaster authorized it, so Teiko hopped on a plane right away!\n\nYou might wonder what Teiko has left to learn here at Akademi if she's already smart enough to be a college professor. The answer is that she wants the "high school experience" that Akademi offers!=Akademi校で最も有名な学生の一人である、Teiko Nabatasaiさんはこの数週間欠席していました。ほとんどの人がその理由を御存知かと思いますが、念の為その理由を記載します。彼女は海外の学校へ留学していたのです。\n\nあなたは今、もしかしたらこう思ったかもしれません。「Akademi校はエリート校でしょ！なんでAkademi校の生徒が海外校で勉強するんだろう？」と。読者の皆さん、その考えは間違っています。Teikoさんは海外で勉強をしていたのではなく、教鞭をとっていたのです！\n\nTeikoさんは複数の言語を流暢に話せるだけでなく、特定の科目では大学教授よりも教育者としての素質があります！他校ではTeikoさんの来校と講義を切望していたほどです。校長はそれを承認し、Teikoさんはすぐさま飛行機に飛び乗りました！\n\nあなたはもしかすると、Teikoさんは大学教授になれるほど賢いのに、なぜAkademi校に在籍し続けていることに疑問を抱くかもしれません。その答えは、Akademi校が与えてくれる「高校生活体験」を彼女が欲しているからです！





Komako Funakoshi is back! She truly needs no introduction, because absolutely everyone at Akademi is already completely familiar with her - but, just in case you hit your head on a rock and got amnesia this morning, I'll introduce you to her, anyway:\n\nKomako is the “Idol“ of our school. No, I'm not calling her a "pop idol"; I'm saying that everyone at Akademi completely idolizes her. She's smart - she's kindhearted - she's humble - she's embodies every virtue that we've ever been told to value! (Oh, and she's a real beauty, too!)\n\nSo, why was she absent this whole time? Our beloved school idol has given us a reason, although it was vague; “Family Business." What could that mean? Well, nobody is rude enough to pry into her personal life; we've all decided to just respect her privacy and not pester her for details.\n\nRegardless, today is a day to rejoice, for once again, we bask in the glory of our radiant Komako! All hail Komako! All shall worship the ground she walks on! Haha...|'m just joking. (Or am I?)=Komako Funakoshiさんが戻ってきました！Akademiでは有名人ですから紹介は不要だと思いますが、頭を岩にぶつけて記憶喪失になった人がいるかもしれないので、念のため紹介しましょう！\n\nKomakoさんは我が校の「アイドル」です。ポップなアイドルではなく、みんなが彼女をアイドルだと思っているということです。彼女は賢く、優しく、謙虚で、あらゆる美徳をすべて兼ね備えています！(さらに、とっても美人です！)\n\nでは、なぜ彼女は欠席していたんでしょうか？我が校のアイドルは曖昧ながらも答えてくれました。「家業」が理由だそうです。どういうことでしょうね？まあ私生活を詮索するのは良くないことですし、彼女のプライバシーを尊重し、詳細は聞かないことにしました。\n\nとはいえ、今日はやっとKomakoさんが戻ってきてくれた日でした。Komakoさんバンザイ！彼女の歩いた地面を崇めずにはいられません！なんてね！
Komako Funakoshi is back! She truly needs no introduction, because absolutely everyone at Akademi is already completely familiar with her - but, just in case you hit your head on a rock and got amnesia this morning, I'll introduce you to her, anyway:\n\nKomako is the "Idol" of our school. No, I'm not calling her a "pop idol"; I'm saying that everyone at Akademi completely idolizes her. She's smart - she's kindhearted - she's humble - she's embodies every virtue that we've ever been told to value! (Oh, and she's a real beauty, too!)\n\nSo, why was she absent this whole time? Our beloved school idol has given us a reason, although it was vague; "Family Business." What could that mean? Well, nobody is rude enough to pry into her personal life; we've all decided to just respect her privacy and not pester her for details.\n\nRegardless, today is a day to rejoice, for once again, we bask in the glory of our radiant Komako! All hail Komako! All shall worship the ground she walks on! Haha...I'm just joking. Students should expect quite a commotion at school today; a genuine celebrity has just enrolled here at Akademi! Even though it's quite late in the school year for a new student to transfer in, the illustrious Chigusa Busujima has decided to join us, starting today!\n\nThe school's female population may not be not familiar with Ms. Busujima's name, but I assure you that every member of the male population is quite aware of her. For the girls out there, I'll spell it out for you: Chigusa is an extremely popular gravure model!\n\nWord has reached me that the Photography club may be assisting Chigusa with a photo shoot near the school pool. This has led to theories that Chigusa only enrolled at Akademi for the purpose of doing one photo shoot and then ditching the school - but is there any truth to this? 0nly time will well.\n\nExpect the hallways to be crowded wherever she walks; nearly every boy in school will doubtlessly be following her around, hoping to bask in her beauty!=本日、Akademiに本物の有名人が入学しました！学生諸君も大騒ぎになることでしょう！一般的な転入の時期からは随分離れていますが、あのChigusa BusujimaさんがAkademiの仲間入りです！\n\nBusujimaさんは女子生徒にはあまりなじみがないかもしれませんが、男子生徒なら誰もが知っていることでしょう。女子生徒のために説明しますが、Chigusaさんは非常に有名なグラビアアイドルなんです！\n\nそういえば、写真部が学校のプールの近くでChigusaさんの撮影に協力するかもしれないとか。Chigusaさんはその1回のためにAkademiに入学し、その後すぐに辞めるという説もあるんですが、その真偽のほどは...？\n\n彼女が歩くと、廊下は混雑することになるでしょう。学校中の男子が、彼女の美しさに酔いしれ、彼女の後を追うからです！
Students should expect quite a commotion at school today; a genuine celebrity has just enrolled here at Akademi! Even though it's quite late in the school year for a new student to transfer in, the illustrious Chigusa Busujima has decided to join us, starting today!\n\nThe school's female population may not be not familiar with Ms. Busujima's name, but I assure you that every member of the male population is quite aware of her. For the girls out there, I'll spell it out for you: Chigusa is an extremely popular gravure model!\n\nWord has reached me that the Photography club may be assisting Chigusa with a photo shoot near the school pool. This has led to theories that Chigusa only enrolled at Akademi for the purpose of doing one photo shoot and then ditching the school - but is there any truth to this? Only time will well.\n\nExpect the hallways to be crowded wherever she walks; nearly every boy in school will doubtlessly be following her around, hoping to bask in her beauty!=本日、Akademiに本物の有名人が入学しました！学生諸君も大騒ぎになることでしょう！一般的な転入の時期からは随分離れていますが、あのChigusa BusujimaさんがAkademiの仲間入りです！\n\nBusujimaさんは女子生徒にはあまりなじみがないかもしれませんが、男子生徒なら誰もが知っていることでしょう。女子生徒のために説明しますが、Chigusaさんは非常に有名なグラビアアイドルなんです！\n\nそういえば、写真部が学校のプールの近くでChigusaさんの撮影に協力するかもしれないとか。Chigusaさんはその1回のためにAkademiに入学し、その後すぐに辞めるという説もあるんですが、その真偽のほどは...？\n\n彼女が歩くと、廊下は混雑することになるでしょう。学校中の男子が、彼女の美しさに酔いしれ、彼女の後を追うからです！





Holy Cow! I've got some MASSIVE news for you today! Sonoko Sakanoue is back at Akademi! Yes, that's right - THE Sonoko Sakanoue! If you don't know who she is, you must have been living under a rock for a while now. She truly needs no introduction - but I'll still give her one anyway!\n\nFrom 1985 to 1988, police were perplexed by a string of seemingly unsolvable murders taking place in Tokyo. After each murder, the police recieved an anonymous letter from a man who claimed responsibility for the crimes, and spelled the name of his next victim using a complicated cipher.\n\nEventually, the police started releasing the killer's letters to the public in the hopes that someone would be able to solve the killer's cipher and decode the name of his next victim. While attending Akademi, Sonoko Sakanoue started studying the killer's cipher as a hobby.\n\nAfter many long nights, Sonoko cracked the code and figured out killer's cipher! She was able to warn the police who the killer was planning to kill next. But that's just the start of her story...=なんと！今日は大ニュースがあります！Sonoko SakanoueさんがAkademiに戻ってきたのです、そう、あのSonokoさんです！Sonokoさんを知らない人がいるなら、きっとその人は岩の下で暮らしていたんでしょうね。紹介など不要でしょうが、少しだけ紹介します！\n\n1985年から1988年の間、警察は東京で起きたある殺人事件を解決できず、迷宮入りになるかと思われていました。犯人は犯行後、次の被害者を指名する暗号を残していました。\n\nやがて警察は、犯人の暗号を解ける人が現れるようにと、犯人の手紙を公開するようになりました。SonokoさんはAkademi在学中、趣味で犯人の暗号を研究していました。\n\n数日後、Sonokoさんは犯人の暗号を解読したのです！そしてSonokoさんの報告によって警察は次の被害者を特定できました。しかし、これは彼女の伝説の始まりにすぎませんでした...
After Sonoko Sakanoue warned the police who the killer was planning to kill next, the police acknowledged her as a prodigy who could potentially help them solve the case, and formally requested her assistance with the investigation, even granting her access to the crime scenes and evidence.\n\nSonoko discovered several new clues and put together some puzzle pieces that the police weren't able to figure out on their own, which eventually led to the arrest of the serial killer! If it wasn't for her help, the killer might have taken dozens of lives before he was eventually caught!\n\nSonoko became a national celebrity once her accomplishments were announced to the public. She was interviewed by countless talk shows and magazines. Needless to say, she really didn't need to stick around in Akademi anymore. She had already achieved success and fame without the school's help!\n\nSonoko left Akademi without bothering to finish her degree, and launched directly into a career as a junior detective. 0ver the past year, she has helped the police solve numerous high-profile crimes!=Sonokoさんは、次のターゲットが誰なのかを警察に報告したところ、警察は彼女を天才と認め、正式に捜査協力を要請し、現場への立ち入りや証拠の閲覧を許可しました。\n\nSonokoさんが新たな手掛かりを沢山見つけ、それをもとに警察が解明できなかった答えを導き出し、ついに犯人は逮捕されたのです！Sonokoさんの協力がなければ、何十人もの人々が犠牲になっていたでしょう！\n\nSonokoさんは一躍有名人となりました。そして学校に在籍する意味がなくなるくらいの名声を得たのです！\n\nSonokoさんはAkademiを退学し、探偵としてのキャリアを始めました。そして、ここ1年間で、彼女は数々の大事件を解決してきたのです！
After Sonoko Sakanoue warned the police who the killer was planning to kill next, the police acknowledged her as a prodigy who could potentially help them solve the case, and formally requested her assistance with the investigation, even granting her access to the crime scenes and evidence.\n\nSonoko discovered several new clues and put together some puzzle pieces that the police weren't able to figure out on their own, which eventually led to the arrest of the serial killer! If it wasn't for her help, the killer might have taken dozens of lives before he was eventually caught!\n\nSonoko became a national celebrity once her accomplishments were announced to the public. She was interviewed by countless talk shows and magazines. Needless to say, she really didn't need to stick around in Akademi anymore. She had already achieved success and fame without the school's help!\n\nSonoko left Akademi without bothering to finish her degree, and launched directly into a career as a junior detective. Over the past year, she has helped the police solve numerous high-profile crimes!=Sonokoさんは、次のターゲットが誰なのかを警察に報告したところ、警察は彼女を天才と認め、正式に捜査協力を要請し、現場への立ち入りや証拠の閲覧を許可しました。\n\nSonokoさんが新たな手掛かりを沢山見つけ、それをもとに警察が解明できなかった答えを導き出し、ついに犯人は逮捕されたのです！Sonokoさんの協力がなければ、何十人もの人々が犠牲になっていたでしょう！\n\nSonokoさんは一躍有名人となりました。そして学校に在籍する意味がなくなるくらいの名声を得たのです！\n\nSonokoさんはAkademiを退学し、探偵としてのキャリアを始めました。そして、ここ1年間で、彼女は数々の大事件を解決してきたのです！
While investigating a crime, Sonoko Sakanoue encountered an investigative journalist who provided her with information that helped her solve the crime. Sonoko was so impressed with the journalist's investigative abilities that she asked him to take her as his apprentice!\n\n0ver the past year, Sonoko and the journalist have worked together as a crime-solving duo, leading to the arrests of numerous criminals. The journalist prefers to stay out of the spotlight, and to this day, has remained anonymous! Nobody knows his full name, except the police he works with!\n\nEver since the murder that took place at Akademi at the beginning of April, Sonoko's mentor has been visiting the school regularly to keep an eye out for suspicious behavior. Akademi is doubtlessly a much safer place with that man present!\n\nAnd, now that Sonoko is back at Akademi, the school just got safer! But, why is Sonoko finally back at Akademi after a year-long absence? Pick up tomorrow's edition of Akademi Daily to find out!=Sonokoさんは、ある事件の捜査中、事件解決のための情報を提供する記者に出会いました。彼の調査能力に感銘を受けたSonokoさんは、彼に弟子入りを申し出ました！\n\nここ1年、Sonokoさんと記者はコンビを組んで事件を解決し、多くの犯人を逮捕して来ました。しかし、その記者は表舞台に出ることを好まず、今日まで匿名を貫いてきました！警察ですら彼のフルネームを知りません！\n\n4月にAkademiで殺人事件が起こって以来、彼はいつも学校に来て不審人物がいないか確認していました。あの人がいれば、Akademiの治安も良くなることでしょう！\n\nそして、現在SonokoさんがAkademiに戻ってきたことで、学校は更に安全な場所となりました！しかし、どうしてSonokoさんはAkademiに戻ってきたんでしょうか？明日の校内新聞に掲載します！
While investigating a crime, Sonoko Sakanoue encountered an investigative journalist who provided her with information that helped her solve the crime. Sonoko was so impressed with the journalist's investigative abilities that she asked him to take her as his apprentice!\n\nOver the past year, Sonoko and the journalist have worked together as a crime-solving duo, leading to the arrests of numerous criminals. The journalist prefers to stay out of the spotlight, and to this day, has remained anonymous! Nobody knows his full name, except the police he works with!\n\nEver since the murder that took place at Akademi at the beginning of April, Sonoko's mentor has been visiting the school regularly to keep an eye out for suspicious behavior. Akademi is doubtlessly a much safer place with that man present!\n\nAnd, now that Sonoko is back at Akademi, the school just got safer! But, why is Sonoko finally back at Akademi after a year-long absence? Pick up tomorrow's edition of Akademi Daily to find out!=Sonokoさんは、ある事件の捜査中、事件解決のための情報を提供する記者に出会いました。彼の調査能力に感銘を受けたSonokoさんは、彼に弟子入りを申し出ました！\n\nここ1年、Sonokoさんと記者はコンビを組んで事件を解決し、多くの犯人を逮捕して来ました。しかし、その記者は表舞台に出ることを好まず、今日まで匿名を貫いてきました！警察ですら彼のフルネームを知りません！\n\n4月にAkademiで殺人事件が起こって以来、彼はいつも学校に来て不審人物がいないか確認していました。あの人がいれば、Akademiの治安も良くなることでしょう！\n\nそして、現在SonokoさんがAkademiに戻ってきたことで、学校は更に安全な場所となりました！しかし、どうしてSonokoさんはAkademiに戻ってきたんでしょうか？明日の校内新聞に掲載します！
Sonoko has stated many times that she regrets her decision to leave Akademi without graduating properly. It's a commonly-known fact that she hates to leave things half-finished. And now, after a full year of remorse, she has finally decided to return to Akademi and finish her education!\n\n...or, at least, that's the official narrative. However, Dear Reader, if you would be willing to indulge me for a moment, I would like to share a theory with you. Please keep in mind that there are no proven facts that are backing up this theory. It's simply a personal belief; nothing more!\n\nSonoko's mentor - the anonymous journalist - seems to have been growing increasingly frustrated with the headmaster's refusal to allow him on school grounds. I think that the journalist asked his apprentice Sonoko to return to Akademi to help him conduct a proper investigation of Akademi!\n\nNow, whether or not this theory is true is quite irrelevant. Either way, with both Sonoko and her mentor on school grounds, we are safer than we've ever been before, here at our beloved Akademi!=Sonokoさんは、Akademiを卒業せずに中退したことを後悔していると何度も発言しています。中途半端が嫌いなことで有名ですからね。そして、1年越しにAkademiを卒業するため、Akademiに再入学することを決意したのです！\n\n...というのがお題目です。しかし、私の個人的な推理を述べさせていただきます。この説を裏付けるような証拠なんてないことを心に留めておいてください。個人的な思い込みに過ぎません！\n\nSonokoさんの師匠の記者は、校長に校内への立ち入りを禁止されています。そこで、記者がAkademiをきちんと調査するために、弟子のSonokoさんにAkademiに戻るよう頼んだのではないでしょうか。\n\nこの説が正しいかどうかは関係ありません。いずれにせよ、Sonokoさんとその師匠が校内に居ることで、我らがAkademiの安全性はかつてないほど高まっています！
Dear Readers, I must apologize! I spent so much time writing about Sonoko this week that I failed to say anything at all about a recent set of circumstances that most of you are doubtlessly curious about!\n\nUpon receiving word that the famous Sonoko was back at Akademi, numerous students flocked straight to her in order to ask if there was anything that she wanted help with. Sonoko didn't wish to interrupt anyone's education, but did offer a task to anyone that was interested in assisting her:\n\nSonoko has asked volunteers to patrol through the school corridors armed with cameras and to snap a photograph of anything suspicious that crosses their vision. (This lends some credibility to the theory that Sonoko is here to investigate Akademi and not to merely finish her education.)\n\nWell, I, for one, feel a lot safer here at Akademi, knowing that a small army of amateur photographers is patrolling the halls. Thank you, Sonoko, for making Akademi a safer place.=読者の皆様へお詫びします。今週はSonokoさんのことばかり書いており、みなさんが知り隊であろう最新の情報について、全く触れていませんでした！あの有名なSonokoさんがAkademiに帰ってきたという知らせを受け、多くの生徒がSonokoさんのもとに集まり、何か手伝えることは無いかと尋ねました。Sonokoさんは生徒の勉強の邪魔をする気は有りませんでしたが、手伝いを申し出た生徒には、ある仕事をお願いしました。\n\nカメラを持って校内をパトロールし、目についた不審なものを写真に撮って欲しいとのことです。(SonokoがAkademiに戻ってきたのは、単に卒業するためではないという説に信憑性が出てきましたね。)\n\n現在、アマチュアの写真家たちがAkademiをパトロールしています。Sonokoさん、Akademiを安全な場所にしてくれてありがとうございます。
Dear Readers, I must apologize! I spent so much time writing about Sonoko this week that I failed to say anything at all about a recent set of circumstances that most of you are doubtlessly curious about!\n\nUpon receiving word that the famous Sonoko was back at Akademi, numerous students flocked straight to her in order to ask if there was anything that she wanted help with. Sonoko didn't wish to interrupt anyone's education, but did offer a task to anyone that was interested in assisting her:\n\nSonoko has asked volunteers to patrol through the school corridors armed with cameras and to snap a photograph of anything suspicious that crosses their vision. (This lends some credibility to the theory that Sonoko is here to investigate Akademi and not to merely finish her education.)\n\nWell, I, for one, feel a lot safer here at Akademi, knowing that a small army of amateur photographers is patrolling the halls. Thank you, Sonoko, for making Akademi a safer place!=読者の皆様へお詫びします。今週はSonokoさんのことばかり書いており、みなさんが知りたいであろう最新の情報について、全く触れていませんでした！あの有名なSonokoさんがAkademiに帰ってきたという知らせを受け、多くの生徒がSonokoさんのもとに集まり、何か手伝えることは無いかと尋ねました。Sonokoさんは生徒の勉強の邪魔をする気は有りませんでしたが、手伝いを申し出た生徒には、ある仕事をお願いしました。\n\nカメラを持って校内をパトロールし、目についた不審なものを写真に撮って欲しいとのことです。(SonokoがAkademiに戻ってきたのは、単に卒業するためではないという説に信憑性が出てきましたね。)\n\n現在、アマチュアの写真家たちがAkademiをパトロールしています。Sonokoさん、Akademiを安全な場所にしてくれてありがとうございます。

土曜日のモノローグ(alternate timeline)=

裁判所
On April 1st, Ryoba Aishi put a note into the locker of Sumire Saitozaki.=No dia 1 de abril, Ryoba Aishi colocou uma nota no armário de Sumire Saitozaki.
After reading this note, Sumire went to the east third floor girls' restroom.=Depois de ler essa nota, Sumire foi para o banheiro feminino do terceiro andar, ala leste.
That was the last time anyone ever saw Sumire.=Essa foi a última vez que alguém viu Sumire.
After she was reported missing, police investigated Akademi for clues.=Após o reporte do desaparecimento dela, a polícia investigou o Akademi em busca de pistas.
In the east third floor girls' restroom, they found some of Sumire's blood.=No banheiro feminino do terceiro andar, ala leste, eles encontraram um pouco do sangue de Sumire.
Shortly before Sumire went missing, Ryoba Aishi was spotted carrying a knife...=Pouco antes de Sumire desaparecer, Ryoba Aishi foi vista carregando uma faca...
...and walking in the direction of the east third floor girls' restroom.=...e indo na direção do banheiro feminino do terceiro andar, ala leste.
Later, she was seen carrying a large garbage bag towards the school incinerator.=Mais tarde, ela foi vista carregando um grande saco de lixo em direção ao incinerador da escola.

...who was interviewed by the police the day after Sumire's disappearance.=...que foi entrevistada pela polícia no dia seguinte ao desaparecimento de Sumire.

Ryoba Aishi killed her in the bathroom with a knife, stuffed her in a garbage bag...=Ryoba Aishi a matou no banheiro com uma faca, a colocou em um saco de lixo...
...and carried her to the incinerator, where she burned all of the evidence.=...e a levou até o incinerador, onde queimou todas as evidências.
Do you deny any of this, Ryoba Aishi?=Você nega alguma dessas acusações, Ryoba Aishi?
I did not kill Sumire Saitozaki.=Eu não matei Sumire Saitozaki.

...but I simply wanted to discuss a personal matter with her; nothing more.=...mas eu simplesmente queria discutir um assunto pessoal com ela; nada mais.
What about the knife?=E a faca?
I noticed that one of the knives in the Home Economics room was missing.=Eu percebi que uma das facas da sala de Economia Doméstica estava faltando.
It turned out that someone had brought the knife to the Cooking Club by mistake.=Acontece que alguém havia levado a faca para o Clube de Culinária por engano.
So, I simply took it from the Cooking Club and put it back in its rightful place.=Então, eu apenas a peguei do Clube de Culinária e a coloquei de volta em seu lugar apropriado.
And the garbage bag? How do you explain that?=E o saco de lixo? Como você explica isso?
I love my school. I can't stand to see trash and garbage piling up everywhere.=Eu amo minha escola. Não suporto ver lixo e resíduos se acumulando em todos os lugares.
I do my part to keep the school clean, just like everyone else does.=Eu faço a minha parte para manter a escola limpa, assim como todos os outros.
Tch! You always have a convenient explanation for everything, don't you?=Tsc! Você sempre tem uma explicação conveniente para tudo, não é?
Do you really think anyone in this courtroom is going to believe your obvious lies?=Você realmente acha que alguém nesta sala de tribunal vai acreditar nas suas mentiras óbvias?
...Mr. Journalist.=...Senhor Jornalista.
There are a number of problems with your theory.=Há vários problemas com a sua teoria.
First of all, you're accusing me of murder, but...=Primeiramente, você está me acusando de assassinato, mas...
...you don't actually have any proof that Sumire is dead.=...você não tem realmente nenhuma prova de que Sumire está morta.
She is still considered "missing," after all.=Ela ainda é considerada "desaparecida", afinal.
I think she simply ran away because of the stress of studying at an elite school.=Eu acho que ela simplesmente fugiu por causa do estresse de estudar em uma escola de elite.
I pray that she is alive and well, and will return to us one day.=Rezo para que ela esteja viva e bem, e que retorne para nós um dia.
You think I killed Sumire because of three facts:=Você acha que eu matei Sumire por causa de três fatos:
I spoke to her, I held a knife, and I burned some trash.=Eu falei com ela, segurei uma faca e queimei um pouco de lixo.
However, none of these things are grounds for suspicion.=No entanto, nenhuma dessas coisas é motivo para suspeita.
Every day at school, dozens of students talk to each other...=Todo dia na escola, dezenas de estudantes conversam entre si...
...touch objects that could be used as weapons...=...tocam em objetos que podem ser usados como armas...
...and carry garbage bags to the incinerator.=...e carregam sacos de lixo para o incinerador.
There was nothing unusual or suspicious about my behavior.=Não havia nada de incomum ou suspeito no meu comportamento.
...you know, I think I've finally figured out what's going on here, Mr. Journalist.=...sabe, eu acho que finalmente descobri o que está acontecendo aqui, Senhor Jornalista.
Your apprentice, Sonoko Sakanoue, became a celebrity after she stopped a killer.=Sua aprendiz, Sonoko Sakanoue, se tornou uma celebridade depois que ela deteve um assassino.
You're desperate to pin a crime on me... because you want to be a celebrity, too.=Você está desesperado para incriminar-me... porque também quer ser uma celebridade.
The only reason that any of us are in this courtroom today is because...=A única razão pela qual qualquer um de nós está nesta sala de tribunal hoje é porque...
...you're deeply insecure that your apprentice has accomplished more than you.=...você está profundamente inseguro de que sua aprendiz alcançou mais do que você.
Order! Order in the court!=Ordem! Ordem no tribunal!
...it's true that there is no smoking gun evidence linking you directly to a murder.=...é verdade que não há uma evidência direta ligando você a um assassinato.
However, with that said... over the past 11 weeks...=No entanto, dito isso... nos últimos 11 semanas...
...you have demonstrated behavior that is suspicious, if not outright incriminating.=...você demonstrou um comportamento suspeito, se não diretamente incriminador.
Your classmates have testified that you've been stalking a certain boy at school...=Seus colegas de classe testemunharam que você tem perseguido um certo garoto na escola...
...following him when he goes shopping... following him when he walks home...=...seguindo-o quando ele vai às compras... seguindo-o quando ele vai para casa...
...by all accounts, you're absolutely obsessed with this boy.=...por todos os relatos, você está absolutamente obcecada por esse garoto.
Furthermore, every time a girl begins to show signs of interest in him...=Além disso, toda vez que uma garota começa a demonstrar interesse por ele...
...something always happens that removes the girl from his life.=...sempre acontece algo que faz com que a garota desapareça da vida dele.
You can't possibly expect anyone to believe that these facts are mere coincidence!=Você não pode realmente esperar que alguém acredite que esses fatos são mera coincidência!
Clearly, you are sabotaging the boy's love life in order to keep him single!=Claramente, você está sabotando a vida amorosa do garoto para mantê-lo solteiro!
And, who else had a crush on that boy? That's right. Sumire Saitozaki.=E, quem mais tinha uma queda por esse garoto? Isso mesmo. Sumire Saitozaki.

Order! I said, order!=Ordem! Eu disse, ordem!

Public opinion is split 50/50 on whether or not you are a killer. Many people will prefer to avoid you.=A opinião pública está dividida 50/50 sobre se você é uma assassina ou não. Muitas pessoas preferirão evitá-la.

独白
A murderous schoolgirl who kills in the name of love... it was a novel concept.=Uma estudante assassina que mata em nome do amor... era um conceito inovador.
Newspapers realized it would get sales. TV stations realized it would boost ratings.=Os jornais perceberam que isso geraria vendas. As emissoras de TV perceberam que isso aumentaria a audiência.
It didn't take long for news of my murder trial to spread across the entire nation.=Não demorou para que a notícia do meu julgamento por assassinato se espalhasse por toda a nação.
I've never seen an event get that much coverage before. It was a real media circus.=Nunca vi um evento receber tanta cobertura antes. Foi um verdadeiro circo midiático.
And, now... everyone in the country knows my name and face.=E agora... todo mundo no país conhece meu nome e rosto.
Even worse... they all know how I feel about my Senpai.=Pior ainda... todos sabem como me sinto em relação ao meu Senpai.
Ohhhh, this is my worst nightmare! I didn't want him to learn about me like this!=Ahhh, este é o meu pior pesadelo! Eu não queria que ele soubesse sobre mim assim!
I wanted our first meeting to be special! Perfect! Exactly like in my dreams!=Eu queria que nosso primeiro encontro fosse especial! Perfeito! Exatamente como nos meus sonhos!
But now... that can never happen.=Mas agora... isso nunca vai acontecer.
He'll never be able to see me as a cute underclassman who has a crush on him.=Ele nunca vai me ver como uma colegial fofinha que está apaixonada por ele.
He'll only be able to see me as that girl who was accused of murder on national TV.=Ele só vai me ver como aquela garota que foi acusada de assassinato na TV nacional.
If I confess my love to him now... I doubt he'll want anything to do with me.=Se eu confessar meu amor por ele agora... duvido que ele queira ter algo a ver comigo.
Even though I was declared innocent... there will always be doubts in his mind.=Mesmo que eu tenha sido declarada inocente... sempre haverá dúvidas em sua mente.
...that stupid journalist ruined absolutely everything.=...aquele jornalista estúpido estragou absolutamente tudo.
There's nothing I want more than to rip his heart out and shove it down his throat...=Não desejo nada mais do que arrancar seu coração e enfiá-lo goela abaixo...
...but spilling any blood right now would only attract more attention.=...mas derramar qualquer sangue agora só atrairia mais atenção.
There are too many eyes on me right now. I have to lay low for a while.=Há muitos olhares sobre mim agora. Preciso ficar fora dos holofotes por um tempo.
Revenge isn't an option at this point in time... but I'll never forget what that man did.=A vingança não é uma opção neste momento... mas eu nunca vou esquecer o que aquele homem fez.
I won't be able to have a romantic confession underneath a cherry tree...=Eu não vou conseguir ter uma confissão romântica debaixo de uma cerejeira...
...but this isn't over yet. I still have one option remaining. My last resort.=...mas ainda não acabou. Eu ainda tenho uma opção restante. Meu último recurso.

Senpai誘拐
It's unfortunate that things turned out like this... but I was left with no other choice.=É uma pena que as coisas tenham terminado assim... mas eu não tive outra escolha.
I would have been crushed if he rejected me. So... I had to take away the option.=Eu teria sido destruída se ele me rejeitasse. Então... eu tive que remover a opção.
Our relationship might be awkward for a little while... but we'll get through it together.=Nosso relacionamento pode ficar um pouco constrangedor por um tempo... mas vamos superar isso juntos.
After all... I know all of his likes and dislikes. (Giggle) I'm sure he'll warm up to me soon.=Afinal... eu sei todas as suas preferências e aversões. (Risinho) Tenho certeza de que ele vai se afeiçoar a mim logo.

But, despite the way things turned out... I don't think the past eleven weeks were a waste at all!=Mas, apesar de como as coisas terminaram... eu não acho que as últimas onze semanas foram um desperdício!
I learned so many new things, and gained so many new skills!=Aprendi tantas coisas novas e adquiri tantas novas habilidades!
I'm sure I'll be able to find a way to put all of my knowledge and talents to good use...=Tenho certeza de que encontrarei uma maneira de colocar todo o meu conhecimento e talentos em bom uso... E, um dia... eu posso passar tudo o que sei para meu filho ou filha!=...e, um dia... eu posso passar tudo o que sei para meu filho ou filha!
(Yandere giggle) There's still so much to look forward to.= (Risada de yandere) Ainda há tanto pelo que ansiar.

年表
The First Aishi is born.=O primeiro Aishi nasce.
Saisho Saikou is born.=Saisho Saikou nasce.
Ryoba's grandmother is born.=A avó de Ryoba nasce.
World War 2 begins.=A Segunda Guerra Mundial começa.
The United States of America invades the Japanese island of Okinawa.=Os Estados Unidos invadem a ilha japonesa de Okinawa.
Saisho Saikou is present at the Battle of Okinawa.=Saisho Saikou está presente na Batalha de Okinawa.
World War 2 ends.=A Segunda Guerra Mundial termina.
Saisho Saikou becomes very active in helping to rebuild post-war Japan.=Saisho Saikou se torna muito ativo na ajuda à reconstrução do Japão pós-guerra.
Saisho Saikou decides that the best way to help his country is with his engineering knowledge.=Saisho Saikou decide que a melhor forma de ajudar seu país é com seu conhecimento em engenharia.
Saisho Saikou starts an electronics repair shop.=Saisho Saikou começa uma loja de conserto de eletrônicos.
Saisho Saikou starts a company named Saikou Corp.=Saisho Saikou funda uma empresa chamada Saikou Corp.
Saisho Saikou invents Japan's first tape recorder.=Saisho Saikou inventa o primeiro gravador de fita do Japão.
Ryoba's grandmother finds her Senpai.=A avó de Ryoba encontra seu Senpai.

Ryoba's mother is born.=A mãe de Ryoba nasce.
Saikou Corp releases the world's first transistor radio.=Saikou Corp lança o primeiro rádio transistorizado do mundo.

Saikou Corp releases the world's first color television set.=Saikou Corp lança o primeiro televisor colorido do mundo.

Sr:
stopped showing romantic interest in him.=Parou de demonstrar interesse romântico nele.
mysteriously vanished one day.=Desapareceu misteriosamente um dia.
confessed to him, but he rejected her.=Confessou seus sentimentos para ele, mas ele a rejeitou.
was arrested by the police for a serious crime.=Foi preso pela polícia por um crime grave.
was arrested for committing murder.=Foi preso por cometer assassinato.
was expelled from Akademi.=Foi expulsa da Akademi.
developed a horrible reputation.=Desenvolveu uma péssima reputação.
took her own life after being bullied.=Tirou a própria vida após ser intimidada.
started dating another boy.=Começou a namorar outro garoto.
Some of the girls who expressed feelings for him are ignoring him now. He worries that there may be something wrong with him that drives women away from him.=Algumas das meninas que expressaram sentimentos por ele estão o ignorando agora. Ele se preocupa que possa haver algo errado com ele que afasta as mulheres.
Some of the girls who expressed feelings for him became the subject of nasty rumors. He has developed a concern that women hide their true selves from him.=Algumas das meninas que expressaram sentimentos por ele se tornaram alvo de rumores maldosos. Ele desenvolveu a preocupação de que as mulheres escondem suas verdadeiras personalidades dele.
He has been fantasizing about the day when he would finally meet his anonymous secret admirer.\n\nHe knows that she is loved by everyone at school.\n\nHe has not experienced any emotional trauma that would prevent him from being able to focus on having a romantic relationship.=Ele tem fantasiado sobre o dia em que finalmente encontraria sua admiradora secreta anônima.\n\nEle sabe que ela é amada por todos na escola.\n\nEle não sofreu nenhum trauma emocional que o impeça de se concentrar em ter um relacionamento romântico.
She never attempted to build a relationship with him by leaving notes or gifts on his desk.\n\nHe has heard some negative things about her around school.\n\nHe has not experienced any emotional trauma that would prevent him from being able to focus on having a romantic relationship.=Ela nunca tentou construir um relacionamento com ele deixando bilhetes ou presentes em sua mesa.\n\nEle ouviu algumas coisas negativas sobre ela na escola.\n\nEle não sofreu nenhum trauma emocional que o impeça de se concentrar em ter um relacionamento romântico.
